page.title: 09EVENTS ON ST.MARTINS,I.O.S.
page.content: Most of the functions are held in the island hall called the Reading Room,for example Country Dances,Discos,Whist Drives,Fancy Dress Parties and fund raising activities. The Reading Room is being extended in 1985,it is having toilets and a kitchen built on.The island men are building the extension,we had to raise some of the money ourselves. Lord Vinson came and laid the foundation stone on May I4th I985,as he is the Chairman of the Development Commision who gave a grant towards the improvements.It is hoped that as the Reading Room is being improved,it will be used more regularly.The present building was erected in I933,and has the crest of the Prince of Wales Feathers above the door.The only competitive game played is cricket,islanders versus visitors.
